definition: bushidō or way of the warrior, samurai code of chivalry
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: The beauty of cherry flowers and military arts give rise to the aesthetics view of Japanese people.
sentences.chinese: 樱花的美，武士道等导致了日本人死的美学观。

sentences.english: They together present the spirit of Bushido.
sentences.chinese: 他们一起传递出了武士道精神。

sentences.english: The way of the warrior is resolute acceptance of death.
sentences.chinese: 武士道，即为凛然赴死之道。

sentences.english: They are well-drilled, but lack the skill and dedication of samurai.
sentences.chinese: 他们训练有素，但是缺乏战斗技巧和武士道精神。

sentences.english: Bushido is the highest principle for traditional Japanese soul.
sentences.chinese: 武士道是传统日本人灵魂的最高准则。

sentences.english: Generally speaking, the way of the warrior is resolute acceptance of death.
sentences.chinese: 一般来说，武士道即为凛然接受死亡之道。

sentences.english: Although they tend to play defense, but they also boasted the Samurai whose reputation proceeds them.
sentences.chinese: 虽然倾向于防守，不过日本也崇尚武士道精神。

sentences.english: The choice of colors is inspired from the samurai.
sentences.chinese: 颜色的选择的灵感也是来自武士道。

sentences.english: I also like your stiff Japanese Bushido, as well as karate.
sentences.chinese: 我也喜欢你木讷日本的武士道，还有空手道。

definition: ODA Nobunaga (1534-1582), Japanese shogun (warlord), played an important role in unifying Japan
phonetic transcription of China (Japanese: Shina), colonial term, generally considered discriminatory
